pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Wednesday, January 11, 2023 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Mexico City, Mexico

Private meetings

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will deliver a keynote address on North American competitiveness and the importance of free trade and inclusive growth.

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

10:40 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a family photo.

Note for media:

  • Open coverage and host broadcaster

10:45 a.m. The Prime Minister and Sophie Grégoire Trudeau will meet with the President of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, and Ms. Beatriz Gutiérrez Müller.

Note for media:

  • Official photographers only

11:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the President of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador.

Closed to media

11:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in an expanded meeting with the President of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador. He will be joined by the Minister of International Trade, Export Promotion, Small Business and Economic Development, Mary Ng, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mélanie Joly, the Minister of Public Safety, Marco E. L. Mendicino, and the Ambassador of Canada to Mexico, Graeme C. Clark.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

12:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a signing ceremony.

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

6:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and Sophie Grégoire Trudeau will depart from Mexico City to Canada.

Felipe Ángeles International Airport

Closed to media

National Capital Region, Canada

11:40 p.m. The Prime Minister and Sophie Grégoire Trudeau will arrive in Canada.

Macdonald-Cartier International Airport

Closed to media
